summary: Implementation matches the manifest: constructor signature and all required printing methods are present with correct parameter and return type annotations. No docstrings or comments are present (complies with generation rules). Only minor concerns detected.

issues.message: Imported name 'Dict' from typing is not used in the module.

Constructor calls logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO), which configures the root logger globally. Manifest allows trivial logger setup but recommends leaving app-wide configuration to bootstrap code.

recommendations: Remove the unused 'Dict' name from the typing import if it is not needed (change to: from typing import Any).

Consider moving logging.basicConfig out of the ConsolePrinter constructor into application bootstrap (e.g., Main) to avoid surprising global logger configuration; if kept, guard it so it runs only once (module-level guard or check if handlers are already configured).
Run a static linter (flake8/pyflakes) to catch unused imports and minor style issues.
